numbered_ace_sentences: 3. You need evidence to substantiate the claim.
4. The evidence must reside in the graph.
5. I ask where the evidence resides in the graph.
6. In-person visits have a lower frequency.
7. Some factors contribute to the lower frequency of in-person visits.
8. I ask what factors contribute to the lower frequency of in-person visits.
10. There is a trend of increased outreach by young women.
11. Some factors explain the trend of increased outreach by young women.
12. I ask what explains the trend of increased outreach by young women.
13. The consequences extend to all students at my high school.
14. I am a student at my high school.
16. Teenagers seek assistance from their parents.
17. I ask to what extent teenagers seek assistance from their parents.
